resources.string: A device with this ID: {deviceAddress} is following you

No devices have been found yet. Every time a device is discovered, a location on the map will be shown where this occurred. This does not mean that someone has tracked you at every location. In most cases you will find devices from others in public transport or from one of your neighbors.
Warns you about a possible tracking device
Support the project by sharing some anonymous data

Whenever the app detects an AirTag or another tracking device, they will be listed here. The list will likely contain devices that did not track you. For devices that track you, you will receive a notification.

Whenever you receive a notification for being tracked by a known device (e.g. an AirTag you own), you can mark them as a false alarm. Devices which do not change their Bluetooth address (e.g. Tile, Chipolo) can also be ignored. These devices will be listed here. Remember: An AirTag changes its Bluetooth address once a day, so even if you mark it as a false alarm it becomes a new one after a day.
If enabled, more detailed tracking information can be provided when being tracked.
By granting this permission, more detailed tracking information can be provided when being tracked. This is an optional feature.
Shows live Information about this tracker
Mark this notification as false alarm
Some beacons were captured without any location data and are therefore not displayed.
Where was the Find My device hidden?
You need to give this permission in order to use this app.

This app has been developed by researchers of the Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany. With our study, we want to find out how many people are affected by malicious tracking attempts. Whether Apple's Find My devices are actually used for tracking people. And ultimately, how well we can protect people from this with our app.
 To join you need to be 18 years or older. 


• We will collect some information about the discovered devices like the device type, RSSI value (signal strength) and the date and time of the discovery 

 • How many notifications have been sent to you, the date and time of the alert as well as the feedback which you can provide optionally


We will NOT share any location data or data which might identify you! The participation is completely anonymous.
This App will notify you when it seems like an AirTag, Find My capable device, SmartTag, Chipolo or a Tile is tracking you.

This app needs the Location permission to allow Bluetooth scanning for AirTags or other Bluetooth Trackers even when the app is closed or not in use. Additionally, you can optionally allow the app to log the location when you have been tracked.
In order to prevent the App from being stopped by Android in the background, we need to disable battery optimization.

To get a more detailed location history in case you\'re being tracked, allow this app to use your location all the time. This app collects location data to enable us to save the location of an AirTag or other Bluetooth Tracker even when the app is closed or not in use. This feature is optional and no location data will leave your device.
This settings will use less energy, but also lead to a worse detection of trackers
This device is not able to play a sound.
Scan this AirTag with your phone via NFC to get more Information.
Show devices that are connected to their owner devices in the scan tab
If enabled, notifications will be issued as an alarm with high priority
Show a list of all used third party libraries and their licenses
View our short and simple privacy policy
Choose which device types AirGuard should observe. Not selected device types will not show up in the manual scan and you will not be notified if such a device follows you.
Please decide if you want to participate or not. All data shared is completely anonymous.
Open the notification to get more info. A tracker has followed you for at least %d minutes.
A tracker has been following you
Open the notification to get more info. The %s has followed you for at least %d minutes.
Open the notification to get more info. The %s have followed you for at least %d minutes.
This permission is needed to provide some more detailed tracking information in case an AirTag, Find My device, SmartTag, Chipolo or Tile is tracking you. This permission is optional.

This app needs permission to access your location to search for surrounding Trackers via Bluetooth Low Energy. Without this permission, the app does not work and will not find any tracking devices. Your location data never leaves your device.
To scan your surrounding for tracking devices, we need the permission to scan for Bluetooth devices!
If a tracking device is found, AirGuard gives you the ability to play a sound on it. For this we need the permission to connect to this device.
To send you notifications when we identified that a tracker is following you, we need the permission to send notifications.
No tracking devices were found. You\'re safe!\nWe only scan for Apple Find My Trackers (AirTags), Galaxy SmartTags, Chipolos and Tiles.
Bluetooth must be turned on to scan for bluetooth devices.
No trackers found during the last %d days
Detected %d tracker during the last %d days

• Scan for the tracker manually and eventually trigger the sound.

• Deactivate the tracker by removing the battery.

• Go to the police with the tracker.

• Make sure that you don’t move to a safe place before you have deactivated the tracker.
I got a notification, what should I do?

• False alarms are possible. Because someone next to you might use a Tracker (e.g. someone in public transport)\n
• If you receive multiple notifications at different days, make sure to use the Play sound feature!
AirGuard uses Bluetooth to scan for devices that follow you.
With the help of location information AirGuard can detect if a tracker is following you to multiple locations!
You get a notification when a potential tracking device is following you! The card above will then change its color to orange or red.
Play a sound and find it
Perform a manual scan and locate it
This setting controls how sensitive the tracking detection is. A higher setting results in a faster but possibly more inaccurate detection.
Use the metric system to display distances
This list only shows trackers that have been following you around in the last 14 days. To view all devices you can change the filter by using the button on the bottom-right corner

This list shows all devices that have been discovered with AirGuard in the last 14 days. This includes devices that are not tracking you.Identified trackers are marked with a exclamation mark. You can filter the devices by using the button in the bottom-right corner
This view shows all locations at which a device has been found. This does include devices, which are not tracking your location.

This list shows all devices that have been found with AirGuard in the past 14 days. Since it is empty no devices have been found. Remember to keep Bluetooth activated, because the app can only find potential tracking devices by using Bluetooth

This list shows only devices that were tracking your location in the past 14 days. Since it is empty no device has attempted to follow you and track your location. Whenever a device is tracking your location, you will receive a notification. Remember to keep Bluetooth activated to find tracking devices. With the button below you can view all devices, even those which have not been identified as a tracker.
Failed to play sound! Please try again!
Could not connect to the Bluetooth Service!

Testing the app? AirTags can only be discovered while they are connected to a nearby iPhone / iPad if this is enabled in the settings. Otherwise AirTags / SmartTags need to be disconnected from Bluetooth for 15min to be discovered within the app. AirGuard does not save connected trackers.
The app is already scanning in the background. Please wait 10s and restart the manual scan

We are trying to find out how many people are experiencing stalking and location tracking attacks. We invite every user to participate in the survey, even if you are not a victim to any of these attacks. This survey is part of our research project at the Technical University of Darmstadt.
How many people are experiencing stalking and location tracking?
Please participate even if you have not experienced such attacks
Conducted by Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany
Do you want to be reminded about the survey later?
Technical University of Darmstadt conducts a survey to find out how people are affected by stalking
Survey on stalking and location tracking
Will always show the app onboarding procedure
Bluetooth is turned off. This app requires Bluetooth to scan for nearby trackers.
Device has not been connected for more than 15 minutes
Device has not been connected to an owner device for a few hours
Device has been connected in the last 15 minutes
Device is currently connected to owner
Information about the connection State of the device
This icon shows the battery status of the tracker
Clicking on this icon shows an explanation for the connection status
Plays a sound on the tracking device
This device has been identified as a tracker
